pr_title: Quartz - Make jdbc store class configurable and use CMT store class by default

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to load the class here? We could use something like String.lastIndexOf("."), or?
timeline.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText: Yes, thought about that but I assumed it is okay since we are at build time?
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's probably ok. But still, we load a class just to get the simple name...
replies.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText: Okay, gotcha. I have updated the code to take into account this feedback.
replies.author: machi1990

timeline.bodyText: What is this used for? It wasn't used before, or?
timeline.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText: Yes, it was not need before since the non managed datasource was not configured. Now we need it so configure the JobStoreCMT class.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: I see. It was JobStoreTX before...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.message:
fix(quartz): make jdbc store class configurable

Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/8555

fix(quartz): make jdbc store class configurable

Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/8555

timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: You can remove that, the config doc generation will do that for you.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +42,29 @@ */ @ConfigItem(name = "datasource") public Optional dataSourceName; + + /** + * The jdbc store class to use when the `db` store type is set. + *

+ * There are actually two seperate JDBCJobStore classes {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} + * and {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} that you can select between, depending on the transactional + * behaviour you need. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} is meant to be used in an application-server + * environment that provides container-managed-transactions. No commit / rollback will be handled by this class. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} manages all transactions for you by handling commit and rollback. + *

+ * If not specified, defaults to using {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT}.

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it should be more generic and not tied to jdbc. I could envision some customization even if not jdbc.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +42,29 @@ */ @ConfigItem(name = "datasource") public Optional dataSourceName; + + /** + * The jdbc store class to use when the `db` store type is set. + *

+ * There are actually two seperate JDBCJobStore classes {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} + * and {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} that you can select between, depending on the transactional + * behaviour you need. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT} is meant to be used in an application-server + * environment that provides container-managed-transactions. No commit / rollback will be handled by this class. + *

+ * The {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX} manages all transactions for you by handling commit and rollback. + *

+ * If not specified, defaults to using {@link org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT}. + */ + @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreCMT") + public Optional jdbcStoreClass;

replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure it makes sense to use generic names here. It's Quartz-specific. On the other hand, it could make sense to use the enum. In fact, it could make sense to change the enum for the QuartzBuildTimeConfig.storeType to RAM, DB, JDBC_TX and JDBC_CMT (where DB is an alias of JDBC_CMT) or something like that.
replies.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText:
+1, I like this better.
Let's go this way and not add another configuration knob.
replies.author: machi1990

timeline.message:
fix(quartz): make jdbc store class configurable

Fixes https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/8555

timeline.bodyText: I think that this should be an error, or?
timeline.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText:
I think we can as well remove this message since, transaction support will be brought transitively by the agroal extension. In build time we have a check that the datasource is properly configured.
WDYT?
replies.author: machi1990

timeline.bodyText: I believe that we should always rollback if something goes wrong, ie. right before throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to create Scheduler", e). Actually, we could change the catch block below to catch Throwable...
timeline.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: InstanceHandle is AutoCloseable so you can just use try-with-catch (although it's not necessary in this case because the UserTransaction is @ApplicationScoped, but better safe than sorry ;-).
timeline.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather use the enum constants, i.e. buildTimeConfig.storeType == DB || buildTimeConfig.storeType == JDBC_CMT.
timeline.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: I would deprecate this value and add a comment that it's retained for compatibility reasons and will be removed in 1.6 (or just "in future versions").
timeline.author: mkouba

replies.bodyText: Great, I was not sure how to go about this. Thanks clarifying it. I'll do it and go ahead and upgrade the quickstarts too.
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText:
Something like this should be OK:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/1.4/independent-projects/arc/processor/src/main/java/io/quarkus/arc/processor/BeanDeploymentValidator.java#L25-L36
replies.author: mkouba
